intro: Leucochlamys callacea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and India. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a hairy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine, white hairs. The flowers bloom in late summer and are pollinated primarily by insects.
